title: Still Life with Flowers and Nuts
titles: Still Life of Flowers and Nuts
description: Bloemstilleven in een terracottavaas op een rechte grijze marmeren plint, links een walnoot en een hazelnoot. In originele lijst; Biedermeier stijl.

principalMakers.name: Anthony Oberman
principalMakers.labelDesc: signed by artist Anthony Oberman (25-jul-1781 - 20-okt-1845), Amsterdam

longTitle: Still Life with Flowers and Nuts, Anthony Oberman, c. 1830

scLabelLine: Anthony Oberman (1781-1845), oil on cardboard, c. 1830

label.title: Still Life with Flowers and Nuts
label.makerLine: Anthony Oberman (1781-1845), oil on cardboard, c. 1830
label.description: Floral still lifes of the Romantic period are characterised by their simple composition, light colour and the profusion of native species. So too in this still life: we see authentic Dutch plants such as primulas, geraniums, periwinkles, forget-me-nots and nasturtiums, as well as plants that were cultivated in glasshouses around 1830: daffodils, anemones, tulips and hyacinths. The blue tulip was originally purple: remains of the lost red pigment are still visible.
